meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of involution.
meanings.sent1: The involutional process of the flower petals turning inward fascinated the botanist.
meanings.sent2: Her involutional thoughts led her to reflect on the passage of time.
meanings.sent3: The involutional pattern on the wallpaper made it look like the room was shrinking.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the involutional clouds seemed to swallow the sky.
meanings.sent5: The involutional design of the maze made it challenging to find the way out.

meanings.sent1: The involutional changes in the caterpillar's body signaled its transformation into a butterfly.
meanings.sent2: The involutional process of healing took time but eventually brought relief.
meanings.sent3: The involutional dance routine required the performers to move gracefully in reverse.
meanings.sent4: Her involutional journey through self-discovery led to a newfound sense of purpose.
meanings.sent5: The involutional growth of the city's population resulted in overcrowded streets.

meanings.definition: Caused by or resulting from involution.
meanings.sent1: The involutional changes in her skin were a natural part of aging.
meanings.sent2: The involutional symptoms of the disease required careful monitoring by the doctor.
meanings.sent3: The involutional effect of the medication helped reduce the swelling.
meanings.sent4: His involutional mindset was shaped by years of introspection and contemplation.
meanings.sent5: The involutional nature of the problem made it challenging to find a solution.
